Overview



In this role, you will be working in a fast-paced, Agile environment with a diverse team that possesses a true passion for technology, transformation, and outcomes. You will play a critical role in the implementation of Waters new Salesforce platform, harnessing the power of cloud, big data, and AI for the changing future of Waters operations across Sales, Marketing and Service. The Principal Salesforce Business Architect will help transform business processes that are supported by Waters’ Salesforce implementation. Through collaboration with stakeholders across Global Markets, the Principal Salesforce Business Architect will bring deep Salesforce and business process expertise to drive Waters towards industry leading practices. You will be responsible for ensuring that solutions being delivered by Water’s Customer Platform team align with established Salesforce-centric process standards and with strategic business direction. Together with the Product Owner, the Principal Salesforce Business Architect rallies support around the vision and executes on it both by leading large-scale, transformational, company-wide initiatives and by constantly evolving platform features and capabilities with enhancements based on ongoing user requests, platform capabilities, and product performance.




Responsibilities



Obtain a deep knowledge of current Waters processes and identify pain point areasChallenge the status quo by providing innovative vision and recommended strategies to simplify and optimize business processes within Waters’ Global Markets functionsPropose future state recommendations to better align with industry leading and Salesforce best-in-class practicesProvide subject matter expertise around the usage of Salesforce and how it aligns with business processes to the broader Customer Platform teamPartner with Salesforce Product Owner and business stakeholders to establish business priorities roadmap and technology capabilities roadmap that is connected to business prioritiesDrive actionable solutions and align the business & IT groups to execute on ideasEvolve people's mindsets and behaviors across the Global Markets organization to help realize the business transformation visionWork with the Platform Architecture Lead to develop Salesforce architectural direction, driving greater innovation across the business solutionsEnsure that business process best practices are followed throughout Waters Customer Platform projects and enhancementsDevelop relationships with key stakeholders; manage expectations and monitor satisfaction levels




Qualifications



Required Skills:Thorough understanding of business process across Marketing, Sales and ServiceStrong knowledge of current environment and trends in the Life Sciences industryGreat listener with an open mind to new ideasWorks effectively with multiple global stakeholdersNavigates ambiguous business situations and identifies a path forward Develops new approaches to accomplish work while clarifying and creating transparency across multiple constituenciesAbility to move fast and drive business value and resultsProven effectiveness at leading and facilitating meetings and workshops with executive-level participantsAble to interact with various levels of an organization both technical and non-technicalStrong point of view and executive presence QualificationsBS in Science or Engineering preferred5+ years of experience in architecting & designing Salesforce solutions5-8+ years relevant leadership or consulting experience driving organizational transformationSalesforce certifications (Administrator, Advanced Administrator, Sales Cloud Consultant, Community Cloud Consultant, Service Cloud Consultant) required. Strong knowledge of Enterprise territory management and Collaborative forecastingCPQ and Marketing Automation (Marketo) experience a plus




Company Description



Waters Corporation (NYSE: WAT), the world's leading specialty measurement company, has pioneered chromatography, mass spectrometry and thermal analysis innovations serving the life, materials, and food sciences for more than 60 years. With more than 7,000 employees worldwide, Waters operates directly in 35 countries, including 15 manufacturing facilities, with products available in more than 100 countries. Our team focuses on creating business advantages for laboratory-dependent organizations to enable significant advancement in healthcare delivery, environmental management, food safety, and water quality.    Working at Waters enables our employees to unlock the potential of their careers. Our global team is driven by purpose. We strive to be better, learn and improve every day in everything we do. We’re the problem solvers and innovators that aren’t afraid to take risks to transform the world of human health and well-being. We’re all in it together delivering benefit as one to provide the insights needed today in order to solve the challenges of tomorrow.     Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our core values at Waters Corporation. It is our responsibility to actively implement programs and practices to drive inclusive behavior and increase diversity across the organization. We are united by diversity and thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, our customers and our community. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender identity or protected Veteran status.
